com.samskivert.util

Class ObserverList<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samskivert.util.ObserverList<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ResultListenerList, WeakObserverList

    public abstract class ObserverList<T>
extends Object
    Provides a simplified mechanism for maintaining a list of observers (or listeners or whatever you like to call them) and notifying those observers when desired. Notification takes place through a ObserverList.ObserverOp which allows the list maintainer to call an arbitrary method on its observers.

    A couple of different usage patterns will help to illuminate. The first, where a new notify operation is created every time the observers are notified. This wins on brevity but loses on performance. 

     ...
     // notify our observers
     final int foo = 19;
     final String bar = "yay!";
     _observers.apply(new ObserverList.ObserverOp() {
         public boolean apply (Object observer) {
             ((MyHappyObserver)observer).foozle(foo, bar);
             return true;
         }
     });
 ...
    The second where a singleton instance of the operation class is maintained and is configured each time notification is desired. 
     ...
     protected static class FoozleOp implements ObserverOp
     {
         public void init (int foo, String bar)
         {
             _foo = foo;
             _bar = bar;
         }

         public boolean apply (Object observer)
         {
             ((MyHappyObserver)observer).foozle(_foo, _bar);
             return true;
         }

         protected int _foo;
         protected String _bar;
     }
 ...
     // notify our observers
     _foozleOp.init(19, "yay!");
     _observers.apply(_foozleOp);
 ...
     protected static FoozleOp _foozleOp = new FoozleOp();
 ...
    Bear in mind that this latter case is not thread safe.

    Other usage patterns are most certainly conceivable, and hopefully these two will give you a useful starting point for determining what is the most appropriate usage for your needs.

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ObserverList.ObserverOp<T>
      Instances of this interface are used to apply methods to all observers in a list.
      static class  ObserverList.Policy
      Notification policies.

      abstract boolean add(int index, T element)
      Adds an observer at the specified index.
      abstract boolean add(T element)
      Adds an observer to the end of the list.
      abstract void apply(ObserverList.ObserverOp<T> obop)
      Applies the supplied observer operation to all observers in the list in a manner conforming to the notification ordering policy specified at construct time.
      abstract void clear()
      Clears all observers from the list.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if this list has no observers, false otherwise.
      static <T> ObserverList<T> newFastUnsafe()
      Creates an observer list with ObserverList.Policy.FAST_UNSAFE notification policy.
      static <T> ObserverList<T> newList(int notifyPolicy)
      Deprecated. 
      Switch to ObserverList.Policy constants.

      Creates an observer list with the specified notification policy.

      • add

        public abstract boolean add(int index,
                            T element)
        Adds an observer at the specified index.
        Returns:
        true if the observer was added, false if it was already in the list.

      • add

        public abstract boolean add(T element)
        Adds an observer to the end of the list.
        Returns:
        true if the observer was added, false if it was already in the list.

      • remove

        public abstract boolean remove(T element)
        Removes the specified observer from the list.
        Returns:
        true if the observer was located and removed, false if it does not exist.

      • apply

        public abstract void apply(ObserverList.ObserverOp<T> obop)
        Applies the supplied observer operation to all observers in the list in a manner conforming to the notification ordering policy specified at construct time.

      • size

        public abstract int size()
        Returns the number of observers in this list.

      • clear

        public abstract void clear()
        Clears all observers from the list.

      • setCheckDuplicates

        public abstract ObserverList<T> setCheckDuplicates(boolean checkDuplicates)
        Configures this observer list to check duplicates when adding observers, or not. By default duplicates are checked, but for performance reasons, one may wish to disable this check.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if this list has no observers, false otherwise.
